awd_titl_txt: Workshop on Practical and Structural Model Theory
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports participation of US-based researchers, including invited speakers, recent Ph.D. recipients, and graduate students, in the international workshop "Practical and Structural Model Theory" held at the University of Leeds, UK, July 25-29, 2022.  The model-theoretic notion of o-minimality was developed around 40 years ago and has had considerable impact in several parts of mathematics. This meeting is devoted to o-minimality in all its aspects and provides a unique opportunity for graduate students and beginning researchers to get involved with, and contribute to, this exciting area.

More than twenty leading researchers will present invited talks at the workshop, covering three general themes: (i) the model theory of o-minimal structures and theories, including the classification of definable groups, (ii) applications of o-minimality, including to algebraic and Diophantine geometry, and (iii) generalizations of o-minimality, including NIP theories, distality, and applications to combinatorics. 

The conference website is https://www1.maths.leeds.ac.uk/~pmtpe/PS/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF NOTRE DAME DU LAC

por.por_cntn:
The ward was meant to f support US-based participants, including invited speakers, recent Ph.D.'s and graduate students, to attend and participate in the conference,Practical and structural model theory, which will be held at the University of Leeds, UK, July 25-29, 2020.

 

The conference recognized the work of Kobi Peterzil and Sergei Starcheno in $o$-minimality, applications, and generalizations. The conference will bring together experts and early stage researchers, including graduate students. The invited talks at the conference will cover three themes; (i) the model theory of $o$-minimal structures and theories, including for example the classification of definable groups, (ii) applications of $o$-minimality, including current and recent work on algebraic and diophantine geometry, and (iii) generalizations of $o$-minimality, including $NIP$ theories, distality, and applications to combinatorics. There will be a wide range of speakers, including Peterzil, Starchenko, and many of their collaborators. It will be an opportunity for young researchers to learn about and get actively involved in some of most exciting developments in model theory and its applications.

 

The award supported two senior speakers, Serge Starchenko and Lou van den Dries.

It also supported the participants: Katie Ellman-Aspnes, Sebastian Eterovic, Kyle Gannon, Yuyan He, Adele Padgett, Nick Ramsey, and Kevin Zhou, who are junior researchers and/or graduate students. 

 

 


Last Modified: 10/17/2023
Modified by: Anand Pillay
